snippet: Amazon's tablet might be so successful it cannibalizes the retailer's e-readers. Analysts are outdoing themselves with forecasts of Amazon's success with the new Kindle Fire. At the same time they are reducing their forecasts of the overall e-reader...
abstract: Amazon's tablet might be so successful it cannibalizes the retailer's e-readers. Analysts are outdoing themselves with forecasts of Amazon's success with the new Kindle Fire. At the same time they are reducing their forecasts of the overall e-reader market, which suggests that they see the basic Kindles losing popularity.
lead_paragraph: Now that the holiday season is history, it is clear that the Kindle Fire did substantially better than many forecasts.

headline.main: Will the Kindle Fire Kill E-Readers?
